fixes.name: Discount Amount
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau row-level expression [Sales]*[Discount] to a DAX calculated column using 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales] * 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount]. This is row-level logic, so created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Health
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau row-level expression [Discount Amount]/[Sales] to a DAX calculated column referencing the computed 'Discount Amount'. This is row-level logic, so created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Performance Code
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Is High Performing ] = "Yes", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] + 2, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] - 1)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF ... THEN ... ELSE ... END to DAX IF(...) for the row-level Performance Code logic and replaced column references with 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Column]. Created as a calculated column since it is row-level.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25, "High Discount", IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10, "Medium Discount", "Low Discont"))
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau nested IF/ELSEIF logic to nested DAX IF(...) expressions and replaced column references with 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health]. This is row-level classification, so created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Final Score
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "Low Discont", 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code] + 1, 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code])
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF ... THEN ... ELSE ... END to a DAX IF(...) expression and adjusted column references to 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Column]. This uses only row-level calculated fields, so it is implemented as a calculated column.
